meanings.definition: The quality of being digressive or wandering in speech or thought.
meanings.sent1: Her excursiveness in conversation made it hard to follow her train of thought.
meanings.sent2: The excursiveness of his storytelling often led to unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent3: His excursiveness during the meeting caused a few chuckles among the attendees.
meanings.sent4: The excursiveness of her mind was like a winding river, flowing through various ideas.
meanings.sent5: The excursiveness of the maze made it challenging to find the way out.

meanings.sent1: The excursiveness of his speech frustrated the audience as he kept veering off track.
meanings.sent2: During the debate, his excursiveness led him to explore multiple side issues.
meanings.sent3: Her excursiveness in the presentation added an unexpected element of surprise.
meanings.sent4: The excursiveness of his argument took the listeners on a journey through various perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The excursiveness of the road trip made it more adventurous and unpredictable.
